title: C++ Comments
text:
Comments can be used to explain C++ code, and to make it more readable. It can also be used to 
prevent execution when testing alternative code. Comments can be singled-lined or multi-lined.

title: Single-line Comments
text: Single-line comments start with two forward slashes (//).

Any text between // and the end of the line 
is ignored by the compiler (will not be executed).
This example uses a single-line comment before a line of code:
This example uses a single-line comment at the end of a line of code:

Example

  cout << "Hello World!"; // This is a comment
Try it Yourself »

examples.heading: Example
examples.code: cout << "Hello World!"; // This is a comment

title: C++ Multi-line Comments
text: Multi-line comments start with /* and ends with */.

Any text between /* and */ will be ignored by 
the compiler:

Single or multi-line comments?
It is up to you which you want to use. Normally, we use // for short comments, and /* */ for longer.

examples.heading: Example
examples.code:
/* The code below will print the words Hello World!to the screen, and it is 
  amazing */cout << "Hello World!";
